WASHINGTON, July 27 Citing reports that Soviet agents are eavesdropping on the telephone calls of hundreds of thousands of Americans, Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan introduced today a bill requiring the President to expel diplomats who engage in electronic surveillance in the United States.

NEWPORT, R.I., July 27 Cutler Godfrey, a member of the small group of natty yachtsmen who go out each day in large vessels to watch the America's Cup boats race, returned to Newport early today. He figured there was no more to see because Enterprise, the going boat, had a comfortable lead of a couple of lengths on Courageous and the race locked up.
NAIROBI, Kenya, July 27 (AP) Ethiopia said today that it had shot down two more Somali fighter planes in fighting with pro-Somali forces for control of Ethiopia's eastern Ogaden region.

WASHINGTON, July 27 (AP) Most American manufacturing, trade and service industries showed significant productivity improvement in 1976 with the only major declines in mining industries, the Labor Department reported today.
Philip Morris's European Backgammon Championship, the year's largest international competition, was held in Monte Carlo July 5-10, under the auspices of the Societe des Bains de Mer.

There was a time not long ago when Grieg's incidental music for "Peer Gynt" was an inescapable fixture of light-classical programs. It seems less popular now, along with so much pictorial sentimental music of the turn of the century, and in this case at least that's a great pity. For this is lovely music, crafted with exact care and invariably capable of making a fresh effect.

SAN FRANCISCO, July 27 Nobody threw any beanballs for a change, but the New York Mets still suffered a casualty today while defeating the San Francisco Giants, 7-4. Their No. 1 pitcher, Jon Matlack, left the game after five innings with a stiff shoulder.
CHICAGO, July 27 Three Texans had won their second major team title in a period of 11 days when the Spingold knockout team championship ended here in the early hours of this morning.

WASHINGTON, July 27 The Carter Administration, in another major policy decision on supplying military equipment to African nations, said today that it had informed the Sudan that the United States was prepared to contribute to its "legitimate defense needs."

UNIONDALE, L.I., July 27 Two policemen spent 45 minutes today trying to convince a despondent man not to kill himself. They pleaded with him, listened to him, tried to soothe him with patience. But 29-year-old Thomas A. Duffy, who sat on the Meadowbrook Parkway clutching a shotgun, took his life anyway.

WASHINGTON, July 27 Why do lawyers write the way they do? Why must wills "give, devise and bequeath," or leases caution "without let or hindrance," or contracts convey "right, title and interest" and all the rest, residue and remainder of legal archaisms?

WASHINGTON, July 27, (Reuters) The House Banking Committee today bowd to criticism from Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve, and dropped a proposal that would have required him to make public forecasts of the Government's interest rate goals.

WASHINGTON, July 27 The Justice Department is seeking "at the highest levels" to get Park Tong Sun back from London to testify in the Korean influencebuying investigation, Assistant Attorney General Benjamin R. Civiletti said today in an unusual public discussion of the case before Junior members of the House.

For now, Alydar appears to be the heir to Seattle Slew as this year's top 2-year-old thorougbred.

PARIS, July 27 A Ukrainian writer and film director who renounced his Soviet citizenship as a protest against the regime has written to President Carter urging him to tell Leonid I. Brezhnev to his face, "Stop lying."

In a classic clash between the Democratic organization and politically active antipoverty groups, the New York City Board of Elections yesterday invalidated the designating petitions of a "povertician" who was challenging the East Harlem district leadership of Frank G. Rossetti, the Manhattan Democratic leader.

WASHINGTON, July 27 (UPI) A preservative used for nearly 30 years in potato chips, cake mixes and other foods should be banned immediately because of safety questions, a public interest group told the Government yesterday.

WASHINGTON, July 27 (Reuters) The Carter Administration today asked Congress for authority to abandon efforts aimed at transferring to private companies government insurance against expropriation and other risks to United States businesses abroad.
